title: Rosewood/Clarendon companion
content:
What would be a good companion for Rosewood and/or Clarendon. I coould use sans or serif suggestions. Thank you.

 [‹ Calling All Designers...](http://web.archive.org/web/20080404214354/http:/www.typophile.com/node/27411 "Go to previous forum topic") [Logo Copyright help ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080404214354/http:/www.typophile.com/node/27310 "Go to next forum topic")
author: signs79

comments.content:
Clarendon and especially Rosewood are colorful typefaces, that probably need some contrast from a clean cut sans serif. STALEMATE, SOPHISTO or even GRAFICZ could be the solution?

[http://www.macrhino.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20080404214354/http:/www.macrhino.com/ "http://www.macrhino.com")
Those are nice solutions. Great typefaces!

I recommend Gothic 13, Alternate Gothic, Monotype Grotesque and Monotype Modern. They are all from pretty much the same time/place. Alternate Gothic Nº 2 is free at Elsner & Flake right now: [http://www.elsnerandflake.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080404214354/http:/www.elsnerandflake.com/ "http://www.elsnerandflake.com/")
